The exact nature of the coming End may vary: sometimes the awakening or arrival of an evil entity, sometimes the discovery and abuse of a powerful artifact, and sometimes a singularly destructive event that endangers the gods themselves, but the martyr must be dedicated to give their lives to stop it. To this end, the gods imbue their martyr with ancient and powerful spells, tools once gifted only to prophets.

When the coming cataclysm threatens the world, a martyr would be ill-served to ignore their call, for the cataclysm imperils them directly—as well as the lives of their family and companions. The life of a martyr is always forfeit, but the rest of the world can yet be saved.

entries.name: Burden Spells
entries: You gain burden spells at the martyr levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Cantrips
entries: Starting at 1st level, your divine mission grants you a sliver of divine magic. You learn the {@spell spare the dying} and {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrips, and one other cantrip of your choice from the {@filter cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric}. You do not lose hit points for casting these spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subclassFeature.name: Balm
entries: Also at 1st level, you can use a bonus action to restore 1 hit point to a creature within 60 feet or remove the {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition poisoned} condition from a willing creature you touch. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrosanct Spell
entries: At 6th level, when you cast a spell with a casting time of 1 minute or longer, or a spell that has the sole effect of restoring hit points, you lose no hit points from casting the spell if you cast it at its lowest level. Casting the spell still counts against your total number of spell uses.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Respite
entries: Beginning at 14th level, when you use your {@classFeature Divine Healing|Martyr|VSS|3} ability to expend Hit Dice and regain hit points, one willing creature you choose within 60 feet can also regain hit points equal to the highest number rolled on a hit die + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Anointed Healer
entries: By 18th level, your status as a divine healer is enshrined in sainthood. Whenever you restore hit points to a creature, you can add your martyr level to the number of regained hit points. Any creature can benefit from this additional healing once, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Rebirth
entries: The gods have seen a great cataclysm on the horizon and tasked their martyr with protecting the world from catastrophe. The exact nature of the coming End may vary: sometimes the awakening or arrival of an evil entity, sometimes the discovery and abuse of a powerful artifact, and sometimes a singularly destructive event that endangers the gods themselves, but the martyr must be dedicated to give their lives to stop it. To this end, the gods imbue their martyr with ancient and powerful spells, tools once gifted only to prophets.

When the coming cataclysm threatens the world, a martyr would be ill-served to ignore their call, for the cataclysm imperils them directly—as well as the lives of their family and companions. The life of a martyr is always forfeit, but the rest of the world can yet be saved.

entries.name: Burden Spells
entries: You gain burden spells at the martyr levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Cantrips
entries: Starting at 1st level, your divine mission grants you a sliver of divine magic. You learn the {@spell druidcraft} and {@spell shillelagh} cantrips, and one other cantrip of your choice from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|class=druid}. You do not lose hit points for casting these spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

subclassFeature.name: Friend of The Forest
entries: Also at 1st level, you can cast the {@spell speak with animals} spell without losing hit points to cast it. When you do so, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks made against beasts for the duration of the spell.
Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrosanct Spell
entries: At 6th level, when you cast a spell with a casting time of 1 minute or longer, or a spell that has the sole effect of restoring hit points, you lose no hit points from casting the spell if you cast it at its lowest level. Casting the spell still counts against your total number of spell uses.

subclassFeature.name: Verdant Resilience
entries: Beginning at 14th level, as a bonus action on your turn you can enter a state of natural regeneration for 1 minute. When you do so, and again at the start of each of your turns during this time, you regain hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier. Also during this time you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage and you can't cast martyr spells. You can use a bonus action to end your verdant resilience early.
Una vez que utilices esta función, deberás terminar un descanso corto o largo antes de poder utilizarla de nuevo.

subclassFeature.name: Turn of The Wheel
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can cast the {@spell reincarnate} spell without providing material components or losing hit points. When you do, you can choose which race the target reincarnates as rather than the GM rolling randomly. If you wish, instead of targeting a dead humanoid with this spell, you can target yourself. Once you cast the spell using this feature you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

If you die without using your Final Martyrdom feature, you can return to life 24 hours after you die as if you were targeted by the reincarnate spell. You can choose which race you {@spell reincarnate} as instead of the GM rolling randomly. Once you return to life in this way, you can't do so again for 100 days.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Revolution
entries: Kings and leaders are bound by an unspoken covenant to the gods to govern their people justly and peacefully. When a monarch turns their back on the gods, embraces tyranny, or uses cruel measures against their own people, a martyr is called to end their reign. Rarely does a Martyr of Revolution come with peaceful measures, for when a king must fall, only the sword can provide the necessary leverage.

Such martyrs are not only called to battle kings; any person of influence that oppresses others and abuses their power might wrong the gods enough to earn the ire of a martyr. In dark times, a martyr might be tasked with clearing a continent of despots and oppressors, calling for a full-scale military campaign of liberation.

entries.name: Burden Spells
entries: You gain burden spells at the martyr levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain proficiency in {@filter heavy armor|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=heavy armor}.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark of Rebellion
entries: Also at 1st level, you can use a bonus action to gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + your martyr level which last for 1 hour. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Blooded Reprieve
entries: Starting at 6th level, whenever you use your {@classFeature Torment|Martyr|VSS|3} feature against a hostile creature and you reduce the target to 0 hit points, you lose no hit points from using the ability.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Banner
entries: At 14th level, your banner is a symbol of resistance. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can add your Wisdom modifier to initiative rolls and are immune to being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Kingslayer
entries: By 18th level, you are the bane of despots, the usurper of tyrants. When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, choose one of the following effects:

items: All of the creature's spells and effects immediately end, including all spells with permanent effects. Spells contingent on the target's death do not trigger.

Each creature within 120 feet of the target which is aligned with it and has a lower challenge rating than it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be frightened of you for 1 minute.
You can use your bonus action to move up to 15 feet and make another melee weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Truth
entries: Tasked with unveiling the world's deceptions and delivering to the people a profound truth, martyrs tasked with the Burden of Truth face an endless battle with disillusionment and lies. Such a martyr must earn the people's hearts and minds, turning their favors away from evil influences and toward divine ones. It is an uphill battle, but one that rarely requires grievous violence except in the most dire of circumstances.

Martyrs of Truth are often deemed prophets, for their gods entrust them with knowledge of  the future, insights into the past, and sagacious perspective on the present. Such information is proof of their messages' divine origin and is a necessary balm, for the truths such martyrs are called to preach are often a bitter pill for listeners to swallow.

entries.name: Burden Spells
entries: You gain burden spells at the martyr levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Moral Erudition
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can add your Wisdom modifier instead of your Charisma modifier to Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks. Additionally, others can naturally sense when you are telling the truth.

subclassFeature.name: Maxim of Truth
entries: Also at 1st level, your force of personality compels others to truthfulness. You can use your bonus action to cast the spell {@spell zone of truth} (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier), centered on yourself with a 5-foot radius area. This effect lasts for 1 minute. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrosanct Spell
entries: At 6th level, when you cast a spell with a casting time of 1 minute or longer, or a spell that has the sole effect of restoring hit points, you lose no hit points from casting the spell if you cast it at its lowest level. Casting the spell still counts against your total number of spell uses.

subclassFeature.name: Foretold Escape
entries: Starting at 14th level, when an attacker that you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of Prophecy
entries: By 18th level, you are the bane of despots, the usurper of tyrants. When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, choose one of the following effects:

items: All of the creature's spells and effects immediately end, including all spells with permanent effects. Spells contingent on the target's death do not trigger.

Each creature within 120 feet of the target which is aligned with it and has a lower challenge rating than it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be frightened of you for 1 minute.
You can use your bonus action to move up to 15 feet and make another melee weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Burden of Tyranny
entries: When malevolent gods find the world pacified and defenseless, they send a martyr of tyranny to conquer its kingdoms, subjugate the weak, and spread misery with their blade. Once unleashed, this martyr stops at nothing to establish an empire to rule over with an iron fist. They demand bloodshed from their foes and pledges of absolute fealty from their allies, taking gleeful satisfaction with every power grab and malicious turn. It is not enough to rule: they must be feared, and any resistance must cower in their shadows. Only then will the gods let them die, likely stabbed in the back by someone crueler or more pitiless.

entries.name: Burden Spells
entries: You gain burden spells at the martyr levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain proficiency in {@filter heavy armor|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=heavy armor}.

subclassFeature.name: Diabolic Ultimatum
entries: Also at 1st level, you can use your action to drive an enemy to harsh choices with a glance. Choose one creature you can see which can see you within 60 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier). On a failed save, the creature is charmed or frightened by you (the target's choice) for up to 1 minute. It can repeat this saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
Una vez que usas esta habilidad, no puedes volver a usarla hasta que termines un descanso corto o largo.

subclassFeature.name: Blooded Reprieve
entries: Starting at 6th level, whenever you use your {@classFeature Torment|Martyr|VSS|3} feature against a hostile creature and you reduce the target to 0 hit points, you lose no hit points from using the ability.

subclassFeature.name: Crush Resistance
entries: By 14th level, your strikes drain the vitality of others. Once on each of your turns, when you hit a hostile creature with a melee weapon attack, you gain {@dice 1d8} temporary hit points. Alternatively, if you reduce a charmed or allied humanoid to 0 hit points with a melee weapon attack, you gain {@dice 3d8} temporary hit points. Temporary hit points gained from this ability last for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Totalitarian
entries: By 18th level, you can demand complete fealty from dire enemies. You can cast the spell {@spell dominate person} once without using hit points or counting against your total number of martyr spells per day. Whenever you cast {@spell dominate person}, the target has disadvantage on its saving throw and doesn't make a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell when it takes damage. Once you cast this spell without using hit points, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

monster.name: Bonebeast
languages: understands all languages it knew in life
as well as the languages of its creator
but can't speak

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The bonebeast has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the bonebeast's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bonebeast has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

Constructed of haphazardly-assembled humanoid bones, a bonebeast looks nothing like a man. Lumbering about on four legs with great boney fangs, the beast can run as fast as a bear and strike as viciously as a lion.

monster.name: Gorger
languages: understands all languages it knew in life
as well as the languages of its creator
but can't speak

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The gorger can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

An unholy tangling of flesh, the gorger still vaguely resembles a humanoid in profile, except for the gaping, toothed maw in its chest. Its colossal teeth are little more than sharpened ribs, but its monstrous bite can easily decapitate.

monster.name: Gravetouched Ghoul
languages: understands all languages it knew in life
as well as the languages of its creator
but can't speak

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The gravetouched ghoul regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the gravetouched ghoul takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the gravetouched ghoul's next turn. The gravetouched ghoul dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

Gravetouched ghouls, which are suffused with terrible necromantic energies, manifest various deformities on their undead bodies. Despite being undead, their flesh knits itself back together nearly as quick as a troll's, with strength to match.

monster.name: Skeleton
languages: understands all languages it knew in life
as well as the languages of its creator
but can't speak

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.
The renanimated remains of humanoids long since dead, skeletons are puppets of bone held aloft by strings of magic.

monster.name: Spirit
languages: understands all languages it knew in life
as well as the languages of its creator
but can't speak

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Grave Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) necrotic damage and the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken.. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A spirit is the scarcely tangible echo of humanoid, a soul bound to the mortal realm by necromantic magic.

monster.name: Visage
languages: understands all languages it knew in life
as well as the languages of its creator
but can't speak

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The visage can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The visage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Horrify
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 5d4 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The visage magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the visage wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

Mournfully longing for the world of the living, a visage is the lingering soul of a departed humanoid. Their yearning for a life once lived binds them to the mortal realm, and drives mad those who see their terrible countenance.

monster.name: Zombie
languages: understands all languages it knew in life
as well as the languages of its creator
but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.
A zombie is the rotting remains of the once-living, held together and driven by dark magic.

monster.name: Abbot
languages: any one language (usually Common)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The abbot is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The abbot has the following cleric spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting  (6th Level)
headerEntries: The abbot's spellcasting improves. It is a 3rd-level spellcaster and has the following cleric spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (10th Level)
headerEntries: The abbot's spellcasting improves. It is a 5th-level spellcaster and has the following cleric spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (14th Level)
headerEntries: The abbot's spellcasting improves. It is a 7th-level spellcaster and has the following cleric spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (18th Level)
headerEntries: The abbot's spellcasting improves. It is a 9th-level spellcaster and has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Turn Undead (1/Long) (2nd Level)
entries: As an action, the abbot presents its holy symbol and speaks a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear the abbot within 30 feet of it must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from the abbot as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the abbot. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

monster.name: Berserker
languages: any one language (usually Common)

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the berserker is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes in Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Long Rest) (6th Level)
entries: If the berserker is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, it can drop to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Rage (10th Level)
entries: The berserker can rage twice before requiring a long rest, and it deals an extra 3 damage when it hits a target with a melee weapon attack while raging.

trait.name: Brutal Critical (14th Level)
entries: The berserker deals one extra die of damage on a critical hit.

trait.name: Rage (18th Level)
entries: The berserker can rage three times before requiring a long rest, and it deals an extra 4 damage when it hits a target with a melee weapon attack while raging.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Rage (Recharges after a Long Rest) (2nd Level)
entries: As a bonus action, the berserker can enter a rage that lasts for 1 minute. The rage ends early if the berserker is knocked {@condition unconscious} or if its turn ends and it hasn't attacked a hostile creature or taken damage since its last turn. While raging, the berserker gains the following benefits:
• The berserker has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
• The berserker deals an extra 2 damage when it hits a target with a melee weapon attack.
• The berserker has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

monster.name: Champion
languages: any one language (usually Common)

trait.name: Martial Prowess
entries: When the champion hits with a melee weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2 damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Ability Score Increase (2nd Level)
entries: The champion's Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase (10th Level)
entries: The champion's Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.

trait.name: Deadly Accuracy (14th Level)
entries: The champion's weapon attack rolls score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Martial Advantage (1/Turn) (18th Level)
entries: The champion can deal an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the champion that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used in two hands.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage in melee or 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage at range.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest) (6th Level)
entries: On its turn, the champion can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + the captain's level.

monster.name: Construct Cohort
languages: understands the languages of its creator (usually Common) but can't speak

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The construct explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Surveillance Protocol (2nd Level)
entries: The construct gains blindsight out to a range of 60 feet. It also adds the captain's level to its passive Perception score.

trait.name: Improved Armor (6th Level)
entries: The construct's Armor Class increases by 1.

trait.name: Death Burst (6th Level)
entries: The construct's Death Burst now deals 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Charged Slam (10th Level)
entries: The construct's slam attack deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage on a hit.

trait.name: Magic Resistance (10th Level)
entries: The construct has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Improved Armor (14th Level)
entries: The construct's Armor Class increases by 1.

trait.name: Unerring Strike (1/Turn) (18th Level)
entries: If the construct misses with a slam attack, it can reroll it.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Cultist
languages: any one language (usually Common)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. The cultist knows the following warlock spells:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting  (6th Level)
headerEntries: The cultist's spellcasting improves. It is a 3rd-level spellcaster and knows the following warlock spells:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (10th Level)
headerEntries: When the cultist makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a d10 to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (14th Level)
headerEntries: The cultist's spellcasting improves. It is a 7th-level spellcaster and knows the following warlock spells:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (18th Level)
headerEntries: The cultist's spellcasting improves. It is a 9th-level spellcaster and knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Agonizing Blast (2nd Level)
entries: When the cultist casts {@spell eldritch blast}, it adds its Charisma modifier to the damage it deals on a hit.

trait.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (10th Level)
entries: When the cultist makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a {@dice d10} to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Hunter
languages: any one language (usually Common)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting  (6th Level)
headerEntries: The hunter is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The hunter knows the following ranger spells:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (10th Level)
headerEntries: The hunter's spellcasting improves. It is a 5th-level spellcaster and knows the following ranger spells:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (14th Level)
headerEntries: The hunter's spellcasting improves. It is a 7th-level spellcaster and knows the following ranger spells:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (18th Level)
headerEntries: The hunter's spellcasting improves. It is a 9th-level spellcaster and knows the following ranger spells:

spells: {@spell haste} (counts as a ranger spell for the hunter)

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The hunter has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Archery Adept (2nd Level)
entries: The hunter gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls it makes with ranged weapons.

trait.name: Two Weapon Fighting (10th Level)
entries: When the hunter engages in two-weapon fighting, it can add its ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Fleet (14th Level)
entries: The hunter can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

monster.name: Mage
languages: any one language (usually Common)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting  (6th Level)
headerEntries: The mage's spellcasting improves. It is a 3rd-level spellcaster and has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (10th Level)
headerEntries: The mage's spellcasting improves. It is a 5th-level spellcaster and has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (14th Level)
headerEntries: The mage's spellcasting improves. It is a 7th-level spellcaster and has the following wizard spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (18th Level)
headerEntries: The mage's spellcasting improves. It is a 9th-level spellcaster and has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance (2nd Level)
entries: The mage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Stalker
languages: any one language (usually Common)

trait.name: Sneak Attack  (1/Turn)
entries: The stalker deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the stalker that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the stalker doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sneak Attack  (6th Level)
entries: The stalker's Sneak Attack damage increases to 7 ({@dice 2d6}).

trait.name: Sneak Attack (10th Level)
entries: The stalker's Sneak Attack damage increases to 10 ({@dice 3d6}).

trait.name: Evasion (14th Level)
entries: If the stalker is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the stalker instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (14th Level)
entries: The stalker's Sneak Attack damage increases to 14 ({@dice 4d6}).

trait.name: Assassinate (18th Level)
entries: During its first turn, the stalker has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the stalker scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action (2nd Level)
entries: On each of its turns, the stalker can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge (10th Level)
entries: The stalker can use its reaction to halve the damage it takes from an attack that hits it. The stalker must be able to see the attacker.

monster.name: Templar
languages: any one language (usually Common)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting  (6th Level)
headerEntries: The templar is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The templar has the following paladin spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (10th Level)
headerEntries: The templar's spellcasting improves. It is a 5th-level spellcaster and has the following paladin spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (14th Level)
headerEntries: The templar's spellcasting improves. It is a 7th-level spellcaster and has the following paladin spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (18th Level)
headerEntries: The templar's spellcasting improves. It is a 9th-level spellcaster and has the following paladin spells prepared:

spells: {@spell spirit guardians} (counts as a paladin spell for the templar)

trait.name: Brave
entries: The templar has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used in two hands.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Divine Hands (1/Long) (2nd Level)
entries: As an action, the templar can touch a willing creature within 5 feet of it, causing the target to regain 9 ({@dice 2d8}) hit points. This ability has no effect on undead or constructs.

bonus.name: Divine Eminence (6th Level)
entries: As a bonus action, the templar can expend a spell slot to infuse its strikes with divine power. The next time it hits a target with a melee weapon attack before the end of its turn, the target takes extra radiant damage. The extra damage is 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for a 1st level spell slot, plus 3 ({@dice 1d6}) for each spell level higher than 1st.

reaction.name: Parry (14th Level)
entries: As a reaction, the templar adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the templar must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Undead Cohort
languages: understands any one language (usually Common) but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the undead to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit.
On a success, the undead drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Turn Resistance (2nd Level)
entries: The undead has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Necrotizing Bite (6th Level)
entries: The undead's bite deals an extra {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage on a hit.

trait.name: Regeneration (10th Level)
entries: The undead regains 1 hit point at the start of its turn. If the undead takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the undead's next turn. The undead dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Improved Necrotizing Bite (14th Level)
entries: The necrotic damage for the undead's bite increases to 7 ({@dice 2d6}), and the undead regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt on a hit.

trait.name: Undead Horde (18th Level)
entries: A humanoid slain by the undead's bite attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the captain's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The captain can have no more than six zombies under its control at one time. The zombies remain under the captain's control for 24 hours, after which the captain must cast the animate dead spell or use similar magic to reassert control over them.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Alchemy Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the alchemy golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The alchemy golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the alchemy golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to half the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The alchemy golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Monstrous Grafts
entries: The alchemy golem's weapon attacks, including monstrous grafts added by its creator, are magical. Monstrous grafts have a +6 attack bonus, deal twice the normal number of damage dice, and have a +5 bonus to their damage rolls. The alchemical golem can only have 1 graft in each slot.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alchemy golem makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Leech
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

A death snail is formed from a vile concoction of forest troll bone meal, giant eagle blood, and goblin bone meal, enclosed in a hollowed-out efreet horn, and sealed shut with an ettercap tongue. The resulting monstrosity possesses a dull intelligence, but its only impulse is to slay all creatures other than its master.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The flying book is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the flying book must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the flying book remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal book.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

Little can be said about the flying book that is not readily apparent. Though it is indistinguishable from an arcanist's spellbook while motionless, this animated arcane tome can flutter through the air at a moment's notice, using its cover as rudimentary wings. Flying books are playful, and enjoy the sensation of being written in.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The fright can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

Hauntings can often be attributed to the usual spectral suspects: ghosts, specters, shadows, and poltergeists. But benign hauntings, where a restless spirit merely plays tricks on the living, are usually caused by a fright. These spirits tend to be the artifacts of children or entertainers, clinging to the afterlife for company and a semblance of affection, and are as such preoccupied with fun. They never willingly harm others when they haunt a house, and they will serve any master that conjures them, if only for the sake of inclusion.

monster.name: Grep
languages: understands Common and Undercommon but can't speak

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The grep has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The grep has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The grep can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

A grep is an underground scavenger, known for using its keen vision, acute hearing, and silent flight to trick and steal from travelers, hoarding its possessions in well-hidden troves. Arcanists use greps as messengers and scouts, but they excel as retrievers; a grep can be given the name of an important object and sent to find it, returning a short time later with its prize.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mock can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. It can only take the appearance of Tiny objects and prefers the form of gold coins and jewels. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mock adheres to anything that touches it. A creature that picks up the mock can't drop it unless the creature succeeds on a {@dc 9} Strength check, made with disadvantage. The mock can only adhere to one creature at a time. The mock has advantage on attack rolls against any creature adhered to it.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the mock remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage. If the mock is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

The diminutive relative of the mimic, the mock is a tiny shapechanger that replicates small, valuable objects to lure in its victims. In the desert, a mock might take the form of a canteen of precious water, and in a dungeon, it may replicate a sizable jewel or a spare gold piece. If an adventurer is caught by surprise, a mock is just as dangerous as its larger relatives, for it can hide in far less conspicuous places.

trait.name: Bioluminescence
entries: The moon jelly sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The moon jelly can only breathe underwater.
Though incapable of surviving on land, moon jellies are favored for their bioluminescence by witches that intend to explore deep underwater.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: The pet rock is indistinguishable from an ordinary rock with a face drawn on it.

trait.name: Just a Rock
entries: The pet rock counts as an object for the purposes of spells and magical effects.
Additionally, the rock can't take actions that aren't specified in its statistics, and its speed can't be increased.

Widely considered to be the perfect familiar, requiring no food or water and possessing extremely high natural defenses, a pet rock can be conjured by most spellcasters. Though it doesn't act with any agility (indeed, it doesn't move at all), it can make a formidable weapon when thrown.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the rag doll remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal stuffed toy.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The rag doll can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 11} Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

Crudely constructed but oddly endearing, rag dolls are constructs formed from children's toys, stuffed with soft material and adorned with smiling faces. Besides being generally comforting to have around, spellcasters favor rag dolls as familiars for their soft construction and inconspicuous nature; nobody questions a discarded doll, after all.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the tin soldier remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal toy.

trait.name: Formation
entries: The tin soldier has advantage on attack rolls when it is within 5 feet of another tin soldier.

action.name: Bayonet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

action.name: Rifle {@recharge}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

Full of ticking clockwork, sprockets, and other gizmos, tin soldiers are mechanical creations fashioned by arcanists as servants and messengers. With some patience and skill, almost anyone can build a tin soldier, but spellcasters have long devised methods to conjure them wholesale from the Plane of Law's excess energies.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The pup has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

When fully grown, a winter wolf is an apex predator of the snow, a terror of teeth and fur, stalking the tundra in packs. But before they develop their fearsome freezing breath, winter wolf pups are far more amicable (perhaps because they have yet to realize the scope of their own might), and will dutifully follow a master that feeds them well and treats them with respect.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the golem remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal ball of yarn.

trait.name: Mutable Form
entries: Whenever a spell or effect would alter the golem's form, the effect works as normal, except that the new form is always made out of a tangle of yarn.

action.name: Tangle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). The yarn golem can only grapple one creature at a time.

The greatest of golems are formed of clay, stone, and iron, but the least of them are constructed of yarn. Balled and sewn into a vaguely humanoid shape, yarn golems are among the first animated objects that arcanists learn to create, practicing with them obsessively until they master the basics and move onto more rigid materials. Yarn golems are friendly and playful, but risk foolishly unraveling themselves if they catch on sharp objects.

trait.name: Cockpit Cover
entries: Any creature inside the apparatus is granted total cover from outside effects, but takes half the damage taken by the apparatus.

trait.name: Double Two-Handed
entries: The apparatus has two mechanical arms, each of which can hold one installed weapon. Each mechanical arm is powerful enough to wield weapons as if with two hands.

action.name: Maul (right hand)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Maul (left hand)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Amphibious Adaptation
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Amphibious trait
{@b Slot:} Head
You have grafted the gills of an aquatic creature to your neck, allowing you to breathe both air and water. Additionally, you attach minimal fins and gain a swim speed equal to your movement speed.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Synapses
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Innate Spellcasting trait
{@b Slot:} Head

You have stolen a bit of arcane potential from a creature by inserting some of its nerves into your brain. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=Wizard}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip.
By harvesting a second creature, you can improve this graft and learn an additional wizard cantrip of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Beast's Hide
entries: {@b Donor:} Beast of Large size or larger
{@b Slot:} External
You have transplanted the thick (and possibly furry) hide from a wild beast onto your body. Your Armor Class equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Bestial Weapons
entries: {@b Donor:} Beast, Dragon, Monstrosity with Bite or Claw attack
{@b Slot:} Arms or Head

You have surgically implanted either the teeth or claws from a monster into yourself, which are natural weapons which you can use to make unarmed strikes. By harvesting a second creature, you can improve this graft to gain both the claws and teeth.

You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack rolls of your unarmed strikes made using your teeth or claws. If you hit with them, you deal damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Your claws deal slashing damage and take up the Arms slot, whereas your teeth deal piercing damage and take up the Head slot.

optionalfeature.name: Charging Hooves
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with a Charge trait or a Gore or Hooves attack
{@b Slot:} Legs

You have replaced your legs with those of a creature known for running down their foes. Once on each of your turns, when you move at least 15 feet in a straight line, you can move up to 10 additional feet in that direction without spending additional movement.

optionalfeature.name: Climbing Apparatus
entries: {@b Donor:} Beast, Humanoid, or Monstrosity with a climb speed
{@b Slot:} Legs
You have replaced or complemented your limbs with those of a climbing creature. You gain a climb speed equal to your movement speed.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with darkvision
{@b Slot:} Head

You have replaced your own eyes with those of a monster with keen nightvision. You gain darkvision, the ability to see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

optionalfeature.name: Doppel-Blooded
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the shapechanger subtype
{@b Slot:} Internal

You transform your appearance for up to an hour. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this ability to become quadrupedal, for instance.
Una vez que usas esta habilidad, no puedes volver a usarla hasta que termines un descanso largo.

optionalfeature.name: Draconis Fundamentum
entries: {@b Donor:} Humanoid, Dragon, or Monstrosity with a Breath weapon
{@b Slot:} Internal

You have installed the mighty source of breath weapons into yourself, and as an action on your turn, you can exhale a wave of energy. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} damage for each point of your proficiency bonus, or half as much on a successful one. The breath's damage is the same type as the donor's breath weapon.
Una vez que usas esta habilidad, no puedes volver a usarla hasta que termines un descanso corto o largo.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon's Hide
entries: {@b Donor:} Dragon of Large size or larger
{@b Slot:} External

You've transplanted the scaly, diamondlike hide of a dragon onto your body. Your Armor Class equals 17. You also gain resistance to one of the following damage types to which the donor dragon was immune: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage. You can only install this graft if you are proficient with heavy armor.

optionalfeature.name: Energetic Suture
entries: {@b Donor:} Celestial, Dragon, Elemental, Fey, or Fiend with immunity or resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage
{@b Slot:} External

You have managed to capture the essence of extraplanar resistance to magic. You gain resistance to one of the following damage types to which the donor was immune or resistant: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Heart of Steel
entries: {@b Donor:} Any construct
{@b Slot:} Internal

You have replaced your heart with the core from a construct. As a result, you can ignore the effects of 1 level of exhaustion, and you only need to rest for 4 hours to gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of rest.

optionalfeature.name: Horns
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with a Gore, Horns, Ram, or Tusk attack
{@b Slot:} Head

You attach a study pair of horns or tusks onto your body, which are a natural weapon that you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Your horns deal the same type of damage as the donor (usually bludgeoning or piercing damage).
Additionally, if you move in a straight line for 10 feet immediately before hitting a creature with your horns, that creature must make an opposed Strength check or be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Fiend's Hide
entries: {@b Donor:} Fiend of Medium size or larger
{@b Slot:} External
You have transplanted the supernaturally tough hide of a fiend onto your body. Your Armor Class equals 15 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum 2).

optionalfeature.name: Indiscernible Anatomy
entries: {@b Donor:} Aberration of Medium size or larger
{@b Slot:} Internal
You have spliced aberrant genetics into your body, which have subsequently altered the placement and composition of your internal organs. Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

optionalfeature.name: Olfactory Implants
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Keen Smell or Keen Hearing and Smell trait
{@b Slot:} Head
You have replaced or modified your nose with that of a creature with keen smell. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

optionalfeature.name: Leaping Legs
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Pounce or Standing Leap trait
{@b Slot:} Legs
You have replaced or modified your legs with the muscular limbs of a bounding creature. Your jump distance doubles. Additionally, you can jump your full distance with or without a running start.

optionalfeature.name: Oversized Arms
entries: {@b Donor:} Giant
{@b Slot:} Arms

You have replaced your arms with a giant's massive limbs. Your melee attacks gain Reach if they did not have it already. If you are Small, you can wield heavy weapons with which you are proficient without penalty. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws you make to maintain your grip on objects.

optionalfeature.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with a Tail attack
{@b Slot:} External

You surgically attach a muscular, prehensile tail, which is a natural weapon that you can use to make unarmed strikes. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack rolls of your unarmed strikes made using your tail. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), instead of the damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Additionally, you can hold and manipulate objects and weapons with your tail, but you can't make attacks with weapons held by your tail or wield a shield with your tail and gain its benefits.

optionalfeature.name: Regenerating Marrow
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Regeneration trait
{@b Slot:} Internal
You have replaced your bone marrow with that of a regenerating creature. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + your Constitution modifier.
Una vez que usas esta habilidad, no puedes volver a usarla hasta que termines un descanso corto o largo.

optionalfeature.name: Replacement
entries: {@b Donor:} Any
{@b Slot:} Any

One or more of your organs or limbs has been replaced with a part harvested from a monster. A replacement can effectively solve any amputation or organ failure, but they cannot return to life someone that has died; such work is solely the domain of necromancy. Replacement limbs can resemble the original limb, or can demonstrate obvious monstrous characteristics, depending on the donor. A replacement organ or limb takes up one body slot relevant to it; for example, a troll's hand takes the Arms slot and a replacement kidney takes up the Internal slot.

optionalfeature.name: Stench
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Stench trait
{@b Slot:} Internal

As a bonus action, you can release a foul liquid contained within an organ taken from the donor creatures. Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus) or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Tentacles
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with a Tentacles or Tendrils attack
{@b Slot:} Arms

You surgically replace or modify one or both of your arms with a flexible tentacle or tendril, which is a natural weapon you can use to make unarmed strikes against targets up to 10 feet away from you. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack rolls of your unarmed strikes made using your tentacle. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), instead of the damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Additionally, when you hit a target with a melee attack using your tentacles, you can use your bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.

optionalfeature.name: Venom Sac
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature which can poison a creature or deal poison damage with an attack not provided by a weapon
{@b Slot:} Internal

You have installed a gland which secretes poison from your body. As a bonus action, you can coat a natural weapon, if you have one, or a weapon you are holding in basic poison. The save DC for the poison equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus.
Una vez que usas esta habilidad, no puedes volver a usarla hasta que termines un descanso corto o largo.

optionalfeature.name: Voice Box
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with the Mimicry trait
{@b Slot:} Head

You have augmented your own vocal folds with those of a creature that can mimic sounds. You can mimic any sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check, contested by your Charisma (Deception) check.

optionalfeature.name: Webspinner Apparatus
entries: {@b Donor:} Any creature with a Web action
{@b Slot:} Internal

You have installed spinnerets from a spiderlike creature into your body, allowing you to produce webs. You can cast the spell {@spell web} without using spell slots or spell components (DC equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus).
Una vez que usas esta habilidad, no puedes volver a usarla hasta que termines un descanso corto o largo.

optionalfeature.name: Bull Rush
entries: When you move at least 10 feet in a straight line and immediately make a melee weapon attack against a creature, you can use a bonus action and expend a battle die to shove the target after the attack. Add the battle die to the Strength (Athletics) check you make to shove the target. On a success, you can push the target 10 feet, instead of only 5.

optionalfeature.name: Bulwark
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can expend a battle die as a bonus action to brace yourself for its counterattack. The next time the creature damages you before the start of your next turn, you can roll the battle die and subtract the result from the damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Cleave
entries: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points or score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can spend a battle die to move up to 15 feet and make an additional melee weapon attack. You add the battle die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Heelcutter
entries: When you make an opportunity attack against a creature, you can expend one battle die to knock the creature off balance, preventing it from escaping. You add the battle die to the attack roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Reckless Assault
entries: When you make an attack against a creature, you can expend a battle die to make a wild, desperate strike, leaving you vulnerable. You have advantage on the attack roll. Until the beginning of your next turn, however, attack rolls against you have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Staggering Strike
entries: As a bonus action when you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can expend a battle die to attempt to stun a humanoid target. On a hit, the target must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Acid Bomb
entries: By mixing your bomb's explosive contents with a few drops of ardenflotic acid, a highly corrosive chemical, you can change it into an acid bomb. An acid bomb deals acid damage instead of fire damage and has {@dice d4} damage dice. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, takes the same amount of damage again at the end of its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Arcano Bomb
entries: By adding an unexpended dynamo to your bomb (and thus expending the dynamo's spell slot), you can change it into an arcano bomb. An arcano bomb deals force damage instead of fire damage, its damage dice are {@dice d12}s, and it deals one extra die of damage, as if a reagent die were added to it.

optionalfeature.name: Black Powder Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive reagent with a charge of black powder, you can change it into a black powder bomb. A black powder bomb has {@dice d12} damage dice.

optionalfeature.name: Bramble Bomb
entries: By adding a potent fertilizer to your bomb's explosive contents, you can change it into a bramble bomb. A bramble bomb deals no damage, and instead causes tough, thorny brambles to sprout from any area of natural ground within the bomb's blast radius, which becomes difficult terrain. Additionally, if a creature in the blast radius is prone when the bomb detonates, it is enveloped by the brambles and must make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check opposed by your bomb save DC in order to move or stand. The brambles shrivel and die after 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Cryo Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive reagent with a piece of ice nine, you can change it into a cryo bomb. A cryo bomb deals cold damage instead of fire damage, has {@dice d8} damage dice, and requires a Constitution saving throw instead of a Dexterity save. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, has its speed decreased by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Holy Bomb
entries: By adding a few drops of holy water to your bomb's explosive contents, you can change it into a holy bomb. A holy bomb deals radiant damage instead of fire damage and has {@dice d8} damage dice, unless the target is a celestial, fiend, or undead. The bomb's damage dice are {@dice d6}s against celestials and a {@dice d12}s against fiends and undead.

optionalfeature.name: Impact Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive reagent with a more reactive one, you can change it into an impact bomb. An impact bomb deals force damage instead of fire damage and has {@dice d8} damage dice. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, is pushed 5 feet away from the center of the blast.

optionalfeature.name: Incendiary Bomb
entries: By adding a thickening agent to your bomb's explosive contents, you can change it into an incendiary bomb. An incendiary bomb has {@dice d6} damage dice. Additionally, the area of the blast radius is engulfed in flames which persist until the beginning of your next turn. Flammable objects in this area that aren't being worn or carried ignite. Any creature that ends its turn in this area takes half the bomb's damage.

optionalfeature.name: Laughing Gas Bomb
entries: By mixing your bomb's explosive contents with a drop of jesterate, a highly euphoric chemical, you can change it into a laughing gas bomb. A laughing gas bomb deals poison damage instead of fire damage, has {@dice d6} damage dice, and requires a Constitution saving throw instead of a Dexterity save. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, falls {@condition prone} in a fit of laughter. Once a creature is targeted by this bomb or succeeds on a saving throw against it, it does not fall {@condition prone} on subsequently failed saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive reagent with a charged arcane capacitor, you can change it into a lightning bomb. A lightning bomb deals lightning damage instead of fire damage and has {@dice d8} damage dice. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, can't take reactions until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Nonlethal Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive reagent with a pouch of rubber pellets, you can change it into a nonlethal bomb. A nonlethal bomb deals bludgeoning damage instead of fire damage and has {@dice d8} damage dice. If damage from this bomb drops a creature to 0 hit points, it knocks the creature out, rather than dealing a killing blow, rendering the creature {@condition unconscious} and stable. Additionally, this bomb's rubber projectiles bounce around corners, ignoring half and threequarters cover for targets within the blast radius.

optionalfeature.name: Oil Bomb
entries: By mixing your bomb's explosive contents with a few drops of a super-surfactant, you can change it into an oil bomb. An oil bomb deals no damage, but coats each creature within the blast radius in a sticky, flammable oil. The next time a creature coated in oil takes fire damage, it takes an extra d6 damage for each die of fire damage rolled, up to a maximum of half your alchemist level, rounded up. This oil can be removed by dousing a creature with a gallon of water.

optionalfeature.name: Painkiller Bomb
entries: By mixing your bomb's explosive reagent with a slurry of analgesic oil, you can change it into a painkiller bomb. A painkiller bomb deals no damage, and instead grants each creature within its blast radius temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} plus half your alchemist level, which last until the end of your next turn. This bomb has no effect on constructs and undead.

optionalfeature.name: Pheromone Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive reagent with a potent pheromone you can change it into a pheromone bomb. A pheromone bomb deals requires a Wisdom saving throw instead of a Dexterity save. The bomb deals no damage, and instead causes the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, to be {@condition charmed} by you until the end of its turn or it takes damage.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Bomb
entries: By mixing your bomb's explosive contents with dust from a psionic crystal, you can change it into a psionic bomb. A psionic bomb deals psychic damage instead of fire damage, its damage dice are d6s, and it requires a Wisdom saving throw, instead of a Dexterity saving throw. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws it makes to maintain concentration on spells until the end of its next turn, including against this bomb's damage.

optionalfeature.name: Quiet Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive reagent with a wad of thermal cotton, you can change it into a quiet bomb. A quiet bomb has {@dice d8} damage dice. When this bomb detonates, it makes only a low thud, audible out to 10 feet, and releases a puff of smoke to mask the light given off by its blast. Creatures have disadvantage on ability checks to detect that this bomb was detonated nearby.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive reagent with a powerful lodestone, you can change it into a seeking bomb. A seeking bomb has {@dice d6} damage dice. You don't suffer disadvantage from making a ranged attack using this bomb while you are within 5 feet of a hostile creature.

optionalfeature.name: Shrapnel Bomb
entries: By augmenting your bomb's explosive reagent with metal bearings, you can change it into a shrapnel bomb. A shrapnel bomb deals piercing damage instead of fire damage, has {@dice d8} damage dice, and explodes in a 10-foot radius.

optionalfeature.name: Slime Bomb
entries: By mixing your bomb's explosive contents with the remnants of an ooze, you can change it into a slime bomb. A slime bomb deals no damage, but coats each creature within the blast radius in a viscous, green slime. No creature coated in slime can take the {@action Dash} action or the {@action Disengage} action. Slime can be removed by dousing a creature with a gallon of water or by taking an action to remove most of it.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: By removing your bomb's explosive reagent entirely, you can change it into a smoke bomb. A smoke bomb deals no damage but fills a 10-foot radius sphere with smoke. This fog spreads around corners and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (atleast 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Once you throw one of these bombs, you can't throw another for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Sonic Bomb
entries: By mixing your bomb's explosive contents with a few drops of air elemental essence, you can change it into a sonic bomb. A sonic bomb deals thunder damage instead of fire damage, has {@dice d6} damage dice, and requires a Constitution saving throw instead of a Dexterity save. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Stink Bomb
entries: By adding a single drop of skunkanide, a chemical too unholy to expound upon, you can change it into a stink bomb. A stink bomb deals poison damage instead of fire damage, has {@dice d8} damage dice, and requires a Constitution saving throw instead of a Dexterity save. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, has disadvantage on ability checks it makes before the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Teleportation Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive contents with a glowing etherite crystal, you can change it into a teleportation bomb. A teleportation bomb deals no damage and instead opens a rift in space, instantly teleporting you to its point of detonation. This effect fails if the bomb explodes more than 30 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Thermobaric Bomb
entries: By replacing your bomb's explosive reagent with a delayed explosive, you can change it into a thermobaric bomb. A thermobaric bomb deals has {@dice d6} damage dice and explodes in a 10-foot radius sphere.

optionalfeature.name: Venom Bomb
entries: By mixing a few drops of a fast-acting toxin into your bomb's explosive components, you can change it into a venom bomb. A venom bomb deals poison damage instead of fire damage, has {@dice d8} damage dice, and requires a Constitution saving throw instead of a Dexterity save. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, have disadvantage on the next Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw it makes before the end of its next turn

optionalfeature.name: Withering Bomb
entries: By mixing your bomb's explosive components with a powerful desiccating agent, you can change it into a withering bomb. A withering bomb deals necrotic damage instead of fire damage, has {@dice d8} damage dice, and requires a Constitution saving throw instead of a Dexterity save. Additionally, the target, as well as each creature within the blast radius that fails its saving throw, can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Bomb
entries: By adding an ounce of polyjuice, an unpredictable, multicolored chemical, to your bomb's explosive contents, you can change it into a prismatic bomb. A prismatic bomb deals damage randomly-determined instead of instead of fire damage, has {@dice d8} damage dice, and requires a randomly determined type of saving throw. Roll on each of the following tables.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Poisoner
entries: Your morbid research into the most vicious, exotic poisons has revealed how to synthesize the following poisons when you brew potions:

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy of Ascendancy
entries: A breakthrough in your alchemical studies has revealed the formulation of several potent elixirs. You can brew the following potions:

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy of Influence
entries: Your alchemical research has revealed many of the basic chemicals which govern emotions. You can brew the following potions:

optionalfeature.name: Alchemy of Transformation
entries: You have mastered the alchemical secrets of shifting matter, which allow you to brew the following potions:

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Study
entries: You learn three cantrips of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=cantrip}. Your casting modifier for these cantrips is Intelligence.

optionalfeature.name: Ballistics Research
entries: You learn two additional bomb formulae.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Training
entries: You gain proficiency with martial weapons and shields.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Haze
entries: When you charm a creature, you can choose to place it in a dreamy state, from which it regards everyone it sees as close friends. While the creature is {@condition charmed}, it is nonhostile and acts as though it is charmed equally by each creature it sees. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Buffered Metabolism
entries: As a reaction when you take damage, you can expend any number of reagent dice up to your proficiency bonus to reduce the amount of damage taken buy the total rolled on the dice.

optionalfeature.name: Clotting Agent
entries: You have developed a serum that protects you from harm. Your hit point maximum increases by your alchemist level + your Constitution modifier, and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Craft Homunculus
entries: Using a special alchemical process requiring 8 hours of work, you can create a homunculus. A homunculus functions as a familiar summoned by the {@spell find familiar} spell, with several differences:

items: The telepathic link between you and your homunculus functions at any distance, provided you and your homunculus are on the same plane of existence.
Your homunculus is a construct and can't assume a different form.
You cannot dismiss your homunculus as you would a familiar.
Your homunculus can take the Attack action on its turn.

entries: When your homunculus dies, its body remains, and can be reanimated as a ritual requiring 1 hour of work, which can be performed over the course of a short or long rest. Your homunculus can take the {@action Attack} action on its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Demolition Spree
entries: When you take the {@action Use an Object} action to prime and throw a bomb, you can throw a number of bombs equal to the number of the bomb's damage dice, instead of only one. Each bomb you throw deals {@dice 1d10} damage plus your Intelligence modifier and can't target the same creature or space. You must spend reagent dice separately on these bombs and can apply a bomb formula to only one of them.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Missile
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can load one of your bombs onto the head of a crossbow bolt. Instead of its normal damage, this bolt deals damage as if you had been primed and thrown, but does not have a blast radius. Only one of your bombs can be loaded onto a bolt at a time and you can't fire an explosive bolt if you have already thrown a bomb on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Brand
entries: As a bonus action you can mix your bomb's reagents together and apply the fiery concoction to a melee weapon you are holding. Until the end of your turn, this melee weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d6} fire damage on a hit. This bonus damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Fire Eater
entries: Instead of throwing a bomb, you can take the {@action Use an Object} action to drink a bomb's contents and spit them out in a 15-foot cone. Each creature within the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw or take damage as if the bomb had been thrown. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. When you use this ability, you take {@dice 1d4} points of fire damage each of your bomb's damage dice.

optionalfeature.name: Fire in the Hole
entries: You have tweaked your bomb's formula to increase its explosive yield. Your bomb save DC increases by half your proficiency bonus, rounded down.

optionalfeature.name: Fortified Serum
entries: Whenever a creature regains hit points by drinking one of your potions, it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Grenadier
entries: When you prime and throw a bomb, you can use your bonus action to make an attack with a weapon that isn't two-handed.

optionalfeature.name: Dynamo Charger
entries: You've invented a device that rapidly recharges your spell dynamos. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can regain 2 expended spell slots stored in dynamos. You can configure these dynamos immediately.

optionalfeature.name: Hemoreagent
entries: When you prime and throw a bomb, you can convert a measure of your own blood into reagents. You can add five or fewer reagent dice to the bomb's damage roll and you take {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage for each reagent die added. This damage can't be avoided or reduced.

optionalfeature.name: Lazarus Bolt
